item.title: InFight not working?
item.dc:creator: @jvwarrior jvwarrior
item.description:
@jvwarrior wrote:

well first u might want to add {.Include SRL/SRL.Scar} to the script to have SRL even included.

and its also best to let us see the entire script because you may have a problem up top or downlow that is causing that problem

Read full topic

item.title: InFight not working?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

procedure FightChicken;
begin
while not InFight do //While we’re not in a fight, sleep
Wait(200); //Don’t need randomness.
Writeln(‘We’‘re in a fight’);
end;

Cleaned it up a bit, not sure why that wouldn’t work.

Also, I noticed in your other thread you called a function a method, unlike Java, SCAR is not case sensitive so you can’t have two vars like inFight and InFight.

Read full topic

item.title: InFight not working?
item.dc:creator: @Maxcor3 Maxcor3
item.description:
@Maxcor3 wrote:

I am making an auto fighter script but it seems that the InFight procedure is not working in SRL. I have my script setup so that if it is in a fight it will just loop until it is not anymore and then it will find the next target. It seems to just skip right over this method though and never stops looking for enemies.

procedure FightChicken; var inFight : boolean; begin inFight := InFight; if inFight then begin intKilled := intKilled + 1; intXP := intXP + 28; end; while(inFight) do begin inFight := InFight; wait(2000); end; end;

Read full topic
